column2: Bearishness has fallen to such an extreme that it supports a significant stock market rally. Just two weeks ago, when I last devoted a column to market sentiment, many short-term market timers were “stubbornly bullish,” treating every market dip as a buying opportunity.
column4: A bullish sign? Nasdaq investor sentiment is worse now than it was in March 2020

column2: The Fed, Washington, and earnings helped the S&P 500 soar after the pandemic. They’re behind its slide now.
column4: The Stock Market Just Suffered Its Worst Week Since 2020. Here’s What Comes Next.
